meanings.definition: To inhale suddenly with a wide open mouth, as when one is surprised or in pain.
meanings.sent1: She would gasp when the magician made the coin disappear.
meanings.sent2: I gasp when I see a spider unexpectedly.
meanings.sent3: The puppy would gasp in mock horror when the toy moved unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The news was so shocking that it made everyone gasp in disbelief.
meanings.sent5: The icy water made her gasp for breath as she fell into the lake.

meanings.definition: A sudden, short intake of breath, often expressing shock or surprise.
meanings.sent1: The audience let out a gasp when the unexpected twist was revealed.
meanings.sent2: A gasp escaped her lips when she saw the surprise birthday party.
meanings.sent3: The loud gasp from the toddler made everyone in the room chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The silence was broken by a gasp of realization from the detective.
meanings.sent5: Her gasp of delight echoed through the room when she won the prize.
